This week I was lucky enough to experience the iconic New York autumn as I rolled into New York city there's something magical about fall in Manhattan It's that's sweet spot between the summer humidity
As I rolled into New York city there's something magical about fall in Manhattan It's that sweet spot between the summer humidity and the icy winter when you can actually walk around town
Feel good and things don't smell so bad
It was late afternoon when I checked into my hotel and dropped off my bags New York is a great walking city and nothing encourages that more than a hotel room the size of a pine home
The streets were colorful is always and Halloween has hit the city have you ever complimented someone's costume and realized he was just a New Yorker wears a milk carton
As a hat [noise] I have
Walked into Washington Square park and sat on a bench near a dog run there is nothing crazier than in New York dog park
These are not dogs that are used to the freedom of backyards and rolling hills these are pets that have been locked indoors for hours drinking coffee trying not to be on the New York post
When they finally get to the dog park they lose their minds
I sat next to one of the dog owners musician named Dave even though he was in sweat pants has long hair and cool Jean jacket said he was a rocker his dog look cool to he was a mutt named Rocco with a spike the collar and an upper lip and a permanent snarl
David lived in the village with Rocco his whole adult life and makes a living now is a studio musician he was lamenting about how the city's changed
There's no scene for the young bands any more so than New York used to be a city of artists weirdos who were too strange to live in their hometown but now there's nothing left at the weirdos can afford
